dataClass
Class Course

java.lang.Object
  dataClass.Course
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
SelectedCourse
public class Course
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class describes a course that a student could take during his/her stay at the university. Asside from the ID of the course and its name, it also contains information about what periods it can be taken, whether it is single or a multi-period course and what courses, that it depends on.

Author:
Niels Thykier, Frederik Nordahl Sabroe, Morten Sørensen
See Also:

INTERNAL_STARTING_PERIOD

public static final long INTERNAL_STARTING_PERIOD
Filter for determining the starting season. If applying this filter on a internal skema is non-zero, the skema is for a multi-period course.

Constant Field Values

courseID

private final java.lang.String courseID
The ID of the course. This is final as no course ought ever to change the ID.

courseName

private final java.lang.String courseName
The name of the Course. Since a course name is not likely to change, it is final.

dependencies

private java.lang.String dependencies
This field contains the ID of all the dependency courses.

private int internalSkema
The internal skema representation bit-flag field.

Constructor Detail

Course

public Course(java.lang.String courseID,
              java.lang.String courseName)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Creates a new Course. This is used by the DatabaseReader, when loading the courses into memory. NB: This will NOT look up all the data from the databases. Use the findCourse from Core or CourseBase.

Parameters:
courseID - the ID of the course.
courseName - the Name of the course.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the ID is null, not exactly 5 characters long, is a negative number, or if the name is null or "".

UserDatabase.loadStudyPlan(String, String)
Method Detail

parseDTUSkema

private int parseDTUSkema(java.lang.String DTUdata)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Parses a DTU based skema and turns it into the internal skema (Bit-flags). If either the DTUdata or the courseLength input is missing, that check will be skipped!

Parameters:
DTUdata - The skema in the DTU format (e.g. E1A is Mondag morning)
Returns:
A bit-flagged integer containing all the flags that matched the input or 0 if the input was not DTU skema Data.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the DTU plan was malformatted.

parseSingleDTUSkema

private int parseSingleDTUSkema(java.lang.String DTUplan)
                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Converts a single DTU skema group into an internal skema bit-flag. The DTU skema is parsed by exploiting the fact that all parts of such a skema are valid hexadecimals and thus the Integer.parseInt is used on it, attempting to parse it as a hexadecimal.

Parameters:
DTUplan - A single DTU skema group (e.g. E1A for monday morning)
Returns:
A set of internal skema bit-flags or 0, if the input was not a DTU skema group.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the DTU plan was malformatted.

getCourseID

public java.lang.String getCourseID()
Get the course ID of the Course.

Returns:
the courseID

skemaToString

public java.lang.String skemaToString()
Transforms an internal skema (bit-flags) to the DTU skema standard. This will not print short courses skemas. This will always output the skema in the same order (Spring before Autumn courses) and thus cannot garantuee to them in the same order as they were converted from. This method heavily exploits the Bit-flags of the INTERNAL_*DAG_* constants. The flags have been added in such an order that if one loops through them they will appear in the order: A1 to A5 and then B1 to B5 This has been exploited so that two simple math operations generate the digit and the trailing letter, using the following: ((i%5)+1) + (1 == (i/5)?"B":"A") NOTE: This will return "", if there are no days for long courses.

Returns:
The DTU skema in a single string.

getCourseName

public java.lang.String getCourseName()
Get the name of the course.

Returns:
the courseName

getDependencies

public java.lang.String getDependencies()
Get the course ID of the dependency courses.

Returns:
A string with the course IDs. This MAY return null, if no courses are loaded!

conflictingSkema

public int conflictingSkema(Course compareTo)
Test if two courses share at least one lession during the week.

Parameters:
compareTo - the course to compare with.
Returns:
0 if there was no conflicts, else the season in which they have conflicts.

setDependencies

public void setDependencies(java.lang.String dependencies)
Update the dependencies with a new set. This is used by the DatabaseReader when loading the the courses into memory.

Parameters:
dependencies - A string containing all the dependencies.

getFullSkemaData

public int getFullSkemaData()
Get the skema as represented by bit-flags. For a textual representation use skemaToString().

Returns:
internalSkema The internal skema data of the course.

setFullSkemaData

public void setFullSkemaData(int skema)
Update the internal skema bit-flags with the input. Note, if the input is 0, it will be silently ignored!

Parameters:
skema - The new bit-flags.

setSkemagruppe

public void setSkemagruppe(java.lang.String skemagruppe,
                           boolean add)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
This method is mainly used by the DatabaseReader to set or add to the Skema data of a course using the data from the files. It uses the Course.parseDTUSkema method.

Parameters:
skemagruppe - The DTU based skema format with exactly one space delimiting each of them.
add - If true, the new data will be merged with the current rather than overwriting the current.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the Skemagruppe is malformatted.

getAmountOfDependencies

public int getAmountOfDependencies()
Get the amont of courses this one depends on.

Returns:
The amount of courses this one depends on.

hasDependencies

public boolean hasDependencies()
Check if the course has any dependency courses.

Returns:
true if this course has any dependencies.

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Overloading of the Object.equals method. This specifies that two courses are the same if their courseIDs are equal. This overloading couses the ArrayList.contains(Course) to return true if a course with the same ID is already in that ArrayList.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
See Also:
StudyPlan.contains(Course), Object.equals(java.lang.Object)

isSameCourseID

public boolean isSameCourseID(java.lang.String courseID)
Test if the course have the same ID as this.

Parameters:
courseID - The ID of the course.
Returns:
true if the courseID match.

getAmountOfPeriods

public int getAmountOfPeriods()
Get the amount of periods this course occupies.

Returns:
The amount of periods this courses takes to complete.

isMultiPeriodCourse

public boolean isMultiPeriodCourse()
Test whether the course is more than one period long

Returns:
true if this course is over more than one period.

updateSeason

public void updateSeason(java.lang.String periods,
                         boolean multiPeriodCourse)
Update the period/semester data for the course. NB: This method will assume that previous data about days are still valid and update accordingly. If a period is removed, all days related to it will be removed.

Parameters:
periods - The periods.
multiPeriodCourse - If true, the input should be treated as the periods the course occupies rather than the periods, it can be selected.

canStartInSemester

public boolean canStartInSemester(int semester)
Check if this course can start in the given semester.

Parameters:
semester - The semester the course should start in.
Returns:
true if this course can start in the given semester.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Turns the Course into a string in the following format: ID Name, skemagruppe: ("the DTU skema",) "perioder" (, forudgående kurser: [the ID of dependency courses])

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
